title: Everything There Is To Know About Kevin Rudd's Political Career | 10 News+
description: Is this the end of Kevin Rudd's political career?   Following the announcement that the iconic Australian politician will be resigning from his role as Ambassador to the US one year early, 10 News+ takes a look at some of Rudd's biggest career highlights, from navigating major international relations to reshaping Australian history. Now it seems the prolific politician is on his way out, of his own volition, with a successor yet to be named. title: Trump Considers US Strikes On Iran As Protests Death Toll Rises | 10 News+
description: Donald Trump is weighing up whether to launch missile strikes on Iran, as the death toll from mass protests in the country reaches up to 650 people. What started as a demonstration against hyperinflation has now turned into a call for regime change. The Islamic Republic authorities have shut down internet and phone services across the country, and Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has warned his country will retaliate against any US attack. title: Adelaide Writers’ Week Cancelled After Controversy And Boycotts | 10 News+
description: Adelaide Writers’ Week has been cancelled, and all remaining members of the Adelaide Festival board will step down after days of controversy over the decision to rescind an invitation to Palestinian-Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah. The prestigious festival removed Dr Abdel-Fattah from the line-up, citing “cultural sensitivities” following the Bondi Beach terror attack. In response, more than 180 authors and speakers pulled out of the event in protest. The director of the Writers’ Week, Louise Adler, has also resigned, saying “I cannot be party to silencing others”. title: Clintons Face Contempt Proceedings After Refusing To Testify In Epstein Investigation | 10 News
description: Former US President Bill Clinton and former US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton have refused a congressional subpoena to testify before a committee investigating Jeffrey Epstein.  In a letter to Republican Representative and House Oversight Committee Chairman James Comer, the Clintons called the subpoena “legally invalid”, adding the investigation was “literally designed to result in our imprisonment”.  Comer is now vowing to begin contempt-of-Congress proceedings against former President Bill Clinton after he failed to show up on Tuesday to testify and may do the same against Hillary Clinton if she fails to answer questions on Wednesday. title: Mass Deaths And Looming Executions In Iran Amid Nationwide Communications Blackout | 10 News
description: US estimates suggest thousands have been killed during Iran’s nationwide unrest, with some broadcasters putting the toll as high as 20,000 and Reuters reporting roughly 2,000 deaths in the past fortnight alone.  No official figures have been released, as families accuse authorities of using executions to crush dissent and spread fear.  They say detainees are being rushed through the courts and scheduled to be put to death as a warning to others.  Among them is activist Erfan Soltani, whose relatives say he is scheduled to be executed tomorrow.  Iran insists it has regained control, but protesters claim a five-day internet blackout is concealing the crackdown, with videos showing bodies in a Tehran morgue and families searching for loved ones. title: Greenland Prepares For Meetings With United States | 10 News
description: Greenlanders are hoping for a diplomatic solution ahead of a meeting between Greenlandic and Danish foreign ministers and US Vice President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio.  The meeting comes amid increased tension surrounding Greenland and Donald Trump's plans for it, with the President making threats to take over the island which is currently an autonomous territory of the Kingdom of Denmark.  Greenland Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen says his nation wants to remain a part of Denmark, rather than become part of the United States. title: Trump Appears To 'Flip off' Heckler At Factory | 10 News
description: Donald Trump has been filmed flipping the bird to a factory worker who heckled him during a visit to a Ford plant in Detroit.  The worker shouted, “paedophile protector”, prompting Trump to point at him and appear to say “f*** you” twice before raising his middle finger.  The White House later defended the outburst to TMZ, calling the heckler a “lunatic” and the president’s response “appropriate”. title: Far North Queensland Towns Remain Cut Off By Heavy Flood Waters | 10 News++
description: Far North Queensland is still reeling from a deluge of rain from ex-Tropical Cyclone Koji, with many towns cut off by heavy floodwaters. An estimated 50,000 head of cattle are estimated to have died.  10 News+ spoke to grazier Ashley Gallagher about how his station is dealing with the devastation. title: Iran Protests Victim Identified, BTS Announces World Tour, Pro-Life Group Targets Canva | 10 News+
description: Despite a complete internet shutdown, one of the victims who was shot dead during the horrific Iran protests has been identified after her family were denied a funeral and forced to bury her in a shallow grave.  Global Korean super sensations BTS have announced their first world tour in years, sending Australian fans into a frenzy.  A new ethical responsibility debate over reproductive rights has Australian company Canva in hot water after it appears they have a strong stance on the matter.
